block.p: The top 10 candidates for the 133rd Kentucky Derby on May 5 at Churchill Downs in Louisville. Horses are listed in order of preference.
By JOE DRAPE
HORSE: 1. Nobiz Like Shobiz TRAINER: Barclay Tagg JOCKEY: Cornelio Velazquez Victory in the Wood Memorial makes him the Derby favorite.
HORSE: 2. Street Sense TRAINER: Carl Nafzger JOCKEY: Calvin Borel Two year-old champ faces salty field on Saturday in the Blue Grass Stakes.
HORSE: 3. Scat Daddy TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez Florida Derby champ just grinds out victories.
HORSE: 4. Great Hunter TRAINER: Doug O'Neill JOCKEY: Cory Nakatani He's the best of the West Coast horses.
HORSE: 5. Circular Quay TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: Garrett Gomez Will go into the Derby off an eight-week rest, which is dicey.
HORSE: 6. Notional TRAINER: Doug O'Neill JOCKEY: Cory Nakatani Florida Derby runner up may be peaking at the right time.
HORSE: 7. Cowtown Cat TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: Fernando Jara Illinois Derby victor is certainly improving.
HORSE: 8. Any Given Saturday TRAINER: Todd Pletcher JOCKEY: John Velazquez Street Sense and Nobiz have defeated him in the last pair.
HORSE: 9. Tiago TRAINER: John Shirreffs JOCKEY: Mike Smith Late run in Santa Anita Derby victory earned him a trip to Churchill.
HORSE: 10. Hard Spun TRAINER: Larry Jones JOCKEY: Mario Pino Faces biggest test yet in the Blue Grass Stakes.

HORSE RACING
